page.title: 01Carnoustie to Easthaven.
page.content: On the road to Easthaven there are houses that are old and new and all shapes and sizes.Most of the road is accompanied by the railway.On the way you pass by a playpark - a meeting place for punks.Some of the roads are very bumpy. When you ride over it on your bike it makes you wonder how these bumps get there.How long have they been there?Why aren't they fixed? As you approach Easthaven the road becomes quite twisty and is dangerous. The alternative route to Easthaven is by the beach.Still water rushes now and again.An enormous wave dashes in like a person dancing.Walking along the beach,your feet sink in the soft sand and the wind blows on the sand and makes a rustling sound.Passing the seven little fishing sheds of West- haven you soon come to the countryside and then you are in tiny Easthaven.
